Participants.evidence: Medical records of 234 hospitalized patients with moderate/severe AS were retrospectively analyzed. Exclusion criteria included acute myocardial infarction, prior valvular surgery, and congenital heart defects.

Objective.evidence: Aim: To assess the impact of common cardiovascular comorbidities on echocardiographic evaluation of AS.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Among the 234 patients (median age 76, 47.4% female), 85.0% had severe AS.

Result_Outcome.evidence: AF was associated with lower aortic valve mean pressure gradient (AVGmean, p = 0.001), peak velocity (Vmax, p < 0.001), and stroke volume (SV, p = 0.01), and higher left atrial (LA) area ( p < 0.001).
